com.google.gwt.gears.client.httprequest
Class HttpRequest

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      com.google.gwt.gears.client.httprequest.HttpRequest

public final class HttpRequest
extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject

The HttpRequest API implements a subset of the W3C XmlHttpRequest specification, and makes it available in both workers and the main HTML page.

abort

public void abort()
Cancels the request.

getAllResponseHeaders

public java.lang.String getAllResponseHeaders()
Returns a string containing the entire set of HTTP headers in the server response.

Returns:
a string containing the entire set of HTTP headers in the server response.

getReadyState

public int getReadyState()
Returns the state of the request.
0 Uninitialized
1 Open
2 Sent
3 Interactive
4 Complete

Returns:
the state of the request

getResponseBlob

public Blob getResponseBlob()
Returns the response body as a Blob. This property can be read when the request is in the Complete state.

Returns:
the response body as a Blob

getResponseHeader

public java.lang.String getResponseHeader(java.lang.String name)
Returns the value of a specific HTTP header in the server response.

Parameters:
name - the name of the header value to return
Returns:
the value of the header

getResponseText

public java.lang.String getResponseText()
Returns the response body as a string. This property can be read when the request is in the Interactive or Complete state.

Returns:
the response body as a string

getStatus

public int getStatus()
Returns the status as a number (e.g. 404 for "Not Found" or 200 for "OK"). This property can be read when the request is in the Interactive or Complete state.

Returns:
the status as a number

getStatusText

public java.lang.String getStatusText()
Returns the status as a string (e.g. "Not Found" or "OK"). This property can be read when the request is in the Interactive or Complete state.

Returns:
the status as a string

getUpload

public HttpRequestUpload getUpload()
Returns an HttpRequestUpload object for accessing properties associated with POST or PUT data uploads.

Returns:
an HttpRequestUpload object for accessing properties associated with POST or PUT data uploads.

open

public void open(java.lang.String method,
                 java.lang.String url)
Specifies the method and URL of a request.

Parameters:
method - a value of "GET", "POST", "HEAD" or another HTTP method listed in the W3C specification
url - either a relative or complete URL which must be from the same origin as the current context

public void send()
Sends the request.

public void send(Blob postData)
Sends the request.

Parameters:
postData - Blob to be sent as the body of a POST or PUT request
